title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Amendments include the inclusion of retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and the repeal of the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to repeal the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation, and includes disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to include disability retirees with less than 20 years of service by striking paragraphs (3) and (4) in subsection (d) and making adjustments to subsection (b). The retired pay of disability retirees with less than 20 years of service may be reduced under certain sections, but only if it exceeds a specific calculation based on years of service and retired pay base. The retired pay of disability retirees may be reduced if it exceeds a specific calculation based on years of service and retired pay base. Amendments have been made to the section regarding concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Amendments have been made to the section regarding veterans' disability compensation, allowing for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation. Amendments to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Effective date is the first day of the first month after enactment and applies to payments from that date onwards. SEC. 3. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is amended to include those entitled to retired pay (other than by reason of section 12731b of this title). Computation rules are also updated for retirees with fewer than 20 years of service. The eligibility for combat-related special compensation for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is expanded to include those entitled to retired pay. Rules for computation are updated for retirees with fewer than 20 years of service, reducing the payment amount for eligible combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees with less than 20 years of creditable service. The eligibility for combat-related special compensation for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is expanded to include those entitled to retired pay. The payment amount for eligible combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees with less than 20 years of creditable service is reduced based on specific calculations. The amendments made by this section shall take effect. The amendments made by this section will affect the calculation of payments for combat-related special compensation for military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The changes will apply to payments starting from the first month after the enactment of the Act.
